archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Habanero Fish Tacos with Cabbage-Lime Slaw
description: Crispy-edged, chile-laced fish tucked into warm tortillas with a sharp cabbage-lime slaw and fresh coriander. Turn up the heat with extra habanero sauce at the table.
prep_steps: Cut lime into wedges; squeeze 2 tablespoons juice into a small bowl.
Pat fish fillets dry with paper towels.
In a bowl, mix 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon habanero sauce, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 minced garlic clove, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper; coat fish with this paste.
Stack tortillas and wrap in foil for warming.
cook_steps: Make slaw: In a large bowl, toss cabbage and red onion with lime juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and a pinch of salt; set aside to soften.
Preheat an outdoor grill (high) or a large stovetop skillet over medium-high. Oil grates or pan lightly.
Cook fish 2–3 minutes per side until opaque and flakes easily; brush with 1–2 teaspoons extra habanero sauce in the last 30 seconds per side for an extra-hot glaze.
Warm tortillas on the grill or in a dry pan 30–60 seconds per side (or in the foil packet for 3–5 minutes on the grill).
Flake cooked fish into chunky pieces.
Assemble tacos: add slaw to tortillas, top with fish, scatter coriander, and finish with more habanero sauce and lime wedges to taste.
